channel.title: Adding arua's [PI]
channel.description:
What file would I start this off? I'm not asking to be spoonfed, I actually don't want to be. I just need to know what file to start off in. I know I have to add a few things in Player.java, but I'm stuck there.
Will Rep++.

Do you have the GFX related to the auras or are you just adding the bonuses?

item.title: Adding arua's [PI]
item.dc:creator: @purestmage74 purestmage74
item.description:
@purestmage74 wrote:

I’d go with playerAssistant.java, simply because it can be used by the surrounding packages, and it inherits everything needed for combat/players editing.

Just make some methods, (I don’t know what the auras actions were never used em), but I’m thinking their like a temporary powerup.

Example:

    public void tempStrengthAura(int time, boolean proceed) {
    	//If time succeeds one minute (assuming your cycle is average)
    	//Stop the aura, set the time to 0, and return;
    	if (time > 59) {
    		proceed = false;
    		time = 0;
    		return;
    	}
          //Initiliaze the time variable when it is equipped/activated
  	  //But handle it in the client.java loop 
  	  if (c.getItems().hasItem(auraId)) {
  		  while (proceed) {
  			  try {
  				  //Here add the power ups/boosts
  			  } catch (Exception aura1) {
  				  aura1.printStackTrace();
  			  }
  		  }
  		  
  	  }
    }

Client.java

//Main loop 
	public void process() {
			//Check if it's equipped/activated
			getPA().tempStrengthAura(0, true);
			//Set the time to ++
			//Might want to change the variable to a public int of time in player.java, (most likely in use)
		}

So with the code above, most likely call it when it’s the item clicked, or bieng equipped (amulet w-e), set the time add+1 every system cycle, (hoping its averaging 500).
Hope it helps m8.

Read full topic
